results.title: Precise measurement in engineering
results.brief_description: Describes how mechanized tools have taken over from the essential work once done by hand. Also outlines the limitations of these machine tools, as well as their benefits, in relation to precise measurement in industry.

results.title: Pre set tooling and automatic control
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Barron, Peter Riding and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Approaching Automation”.
Adapted metal cutting machines can greatly improve quality control, reduce scrap, decrease operator fatigue, and generally allow labour to be used more efficiently. Dealing with the use of a capstan lathe it is proposed that a job should be able to be rest before t becomes necessary. Problems of suing hie method are discussed and types pf controls available for particular jobs including fluid logic and pneumatic circuitry.

results.title: Pre history of man: on the threshold of consciousness
results.brief_description: An illustration of Pavlov’s theories of how human skills and instincts may have developed from his ape-like ancestors. The responses of monkeys and their ability to learn and to work out problems are demonstrated, with their implications about human behaviour. Research materials used in this film were provided by the academic Ivan Pavlov and Professors Voronin, Gerasimor, Ladygina-Kots, Roginsky, Semyonov, Tikh and Yakimov.

results.title: Pre-operative care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Demonstrates the method of preparing a patient both mentally and physically for an appendectomy operation. Shows the method of preparing the operative field for abdominal or bone operations.

results.title: Pre-occupied
results.creator_credit: Trish Carney, Victorian Women's Film Unit and Solrun Hoaas
results.brief_description: Using the device of a film within a film, “Pre-occupied” explores the decision to have or not to have children, while at the same time examining the roles and responsibilities of the documentary filmmaker. Cast includes: Victoria Arthur, Sue Jones, Samuel Krum, Rebecca Botelor, Greg Carroll, Carolyn Howard, Howard Stanley and others.

results.title: Pre-modern, 1845-1900
results.creator_credit: Joyce Fox, Matt Newman, Mary Watanabe, Janet Schloat, Educational Audio Visual and Clearvue
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History through art”.
The pre-modern period traces the many diverse artistic movements that developed during the second half of the nineteenth century. This video looks at realism and artists such as Gustav Courbet. The development of impressionism with artists such as Edouard Manet, and the emergence of post-impressionism including the formalists Seurat and Cezanne and the expressionists Van Gogh and Gauguin are also examined. Hosted by Nancy Sellers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joyce Fox, Matt Newman, Mary Watanabe, Janet Schloat, Educational Audio Visual and Clearvue
